titleStmt.title: Beautiful blossomes, gathered by Iohn Byshop, from the best trees of all kyndes, diuine, philosophicall, astronomicall, cosmographical, historical, & humane, that are growing in Greece, Latium, and Arabia, and some also in vulgar orchards, as wel fro[m] those that in auncient time were grafted, as also from them which haue with skilful head and hand beene of late yeares, yea, and in our dayes planted: to the vnspeakable, both pleasure and profite of all such wil vouchsafe to vse them. The first tome
titleStmt.author: Bishop, John, d. 1613.

publicationStmt.publisher: [By H. Middleton] for Henrie Cockyn, dwelling in Fletestreate at the signe of the Elephant, a litle aboue the Conduit,

notesStmt.note: With four final contents leaves and a final errata leaf.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: Fletestreate at the signe of the Elephant, a litle aboue the Conduit
